textBeforeTable: Hackable:1 [rev5] Hackable:1 is a community distribution for hackable devices like the Neo Freerunner. It is based on Debian and implements the GNOME mobile platform. See Architecture for details. The goals are: * provide a Stable platform for development * encourage Quick start * enjoy Ease of development Codename: 'chuck' Homepage: http://www.hackable1.org/ Image: http://www.hackable1.org/wiki/Downloads Images [edit] Distributions [edit] Period 2009-10-15 to 2009-10-28 6.3 Community Influence 6.2 Documentation 6.1 Work Distribution 6 Openmoko Development Survey 5 Event News 4 Community 3.2 Application Updates 3.1 New Applications 3 Applications 2 Distributions 1 Period 2009-10-15 to 2009-10-28 Contents Latest revision as of 06:34, 2 November 2009
textAfterTable: [edit] Applications [edit] New Applications kbosd Small and simple virtual keyboard for OpenMoko FreeRunner, inspired from fatfingershell. The idea was to use XShape extention to display the virtual keyboard above the terminal Homepage: http://gitorious.org/kbosd Package: not known yet Tested on: hackable:1 rev5 [edit] Application Updates xminimokostatus xminimokostatus is the background on the root window of Minimoko, a fast and lean Desktop based on shr, openbox and idesk using DBUS in C with glib Homepage: http://wiki.openmoko.org/wiki/Minimoko Package: Xminimokostatus Tested on: SHR-Unstable ffalarms 0.3 ffalarms is a finger friendly alarms application. Notes: add support for recurring alarms, attaching messages to alarms, and choosing alarm date from a calendar add configuration option for alarm volume, alarm_script and alsa_state Homepage:
